snippet: Prime Minister Najib Razak said in a news conference that data indicated that someone took action to change the course of the plane, which traveled for seven hours after it lost contact with ground control.
abstract: Search for Malaysia Airlines Flight 370 turns into a criminal investigation after Malaysia declares that the plane had been deliberately diverted and then flown for as long as seven hours toward an unknown point; Prime Min Najib Razak says he will seek the help of governments across a large expanse of Asia.

byline.original: By KEITH BRADSHER and CHRIS BUCKLEY
byline.contributor: Michael Forsythe contributed reporting from Sepang, Kirk Semple from Kuala Lumpur and Nicola Clark from Paris. Edward Wong contributed reporting from Beijing, and Mia Li contributed research from Beijing.  Reporting was contributed by Nicola Clark from Paris; Michael Forsythe and Kirk Semple from Kuala Lumpur; Edward Wong from Beijing; Michael S. Schmidt from Washington; and Emma G. Fitzsimmons from New York. Mia Li contributed research from Beijing.

lead_paragraph: Prime Minister Najib Razak said in a news conference that data indicated that someone took action to change the course of the plane, which traveled for seven hours after it lost contact with ground control.

headline.sub: Plane Deliberately Diverted, Malaysia Premier Says
headline.main: Malaysia Officials Open Criminal Inquiry Into Missing Jet
headline.print_headline: Saying Missing Jet Was Diverted, Malaysia Opens Criminal Inquiry
